item.title: By: Why am I writing about race? | Opinion In Progress
item.dc:creator: Why am I writing about race? | Opinion In Progress
item.description: […] challenging myself to figure out the point of actually writing posts for this blog. Then I read a post on Nanette Massey’s blog that wasn’t written about me specifically, but might as well have been. I’ve re-read […]
item.content:encoded: […] challenging myself to figure out the point of actually writing posts for this blog. Then I read a post on Nanette Massey’s blog that wasn’t written about me specifically, but might as well have been.  I’ve re-read […]

item.title: By: Howard J. Eagle
item.dc:creator: Howard J. Eagle
item.description: Indeed Nanette --- "Where are all these new awarenesses showing up in life where the rubber meets the road?"
item.content:encoded: Indeed Nanette — “Where are all these new awarenesses showing up in life where the rubber meets the road?”

item.title: By: Nanette D. Massey
item.dc:creator: Nanette D. Massey
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://samj921.github.io/nanettedmassey/wheres-the-beef/#comment-41">Frank Staropoli</a>.
Wow Frank. I really didn't expect this to get back to you so soon. And I certainly didn't expect such an open hearted response. I did originally write this on your page as a response to "Layer Upon Layer" (https://staropoli.com/2019/11/11/layer-upon-layer-uncovering-bias/). Guess I didn't hit the button right to make it happen. I'm honestly still SO clueless about how this whole inter-web thing works. I give you my permission to take this and re-post it for your next entry as a guest submission.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Frank Staropoli.

Wow Frank. I really didn’t expect this to get back to you so soon. And I certainly didn’t expect such an open hearted response. I did originally write this on your page as a response to “Layer Upon Layer” (https://staropoli.com/2019/11/11/layer-upon-layer-uncovering-bias/). Guess I didn’t hit the button right to make it happen. I’m honestly still SO clueless about how this whole inter-web thing works. I give you my permission to take this and re-post it for your next entry as a guest submission.

item.title: By: Frank Staropoli
item.dc:creator: Frank Staropoli
item.description: Nanette, from the beginning, I've appreciated your writing. You get right to it, and in creative, expressive ways. I presume I'm the "Frank" you mean, but I never saw these comments appear in reply to my post. I'd like my readers to see this too. So if you would, please reply there. Yes, this is the same message Howard has been conveying. I tried to make it clear at the end of the post that the whole point of this "work" is to check the impact of all our white stuff so it doesn't infect our action, to give us a way to measure that. But I get that thinking about all that is still not ACTION itself. That's why I'd like you to post this comment to my blog. Better yet: Howard wrote a guest essay for my blog about a year ago. Would you be willing to contribute this post - or some version of it - as a guest blog? It would be due to come out Dec.10. If you leave it as a reply on my blog now, I doubt that anyone is going to see it. It's late. But all subscribers would see it next post. What do you think?
item.content:encoded:
Nanette, from the beginning, I’ve appreciated your writing. You get right to it, and in creative, expressive ways. I presume I’m the “Frank” you mean, but I never saw these comments appear in reply to my post. I’d like my readers to see this too. So if you would, please reply there.
Yes, this is the same message Howard has been conveying. I tried to make it clear at the end of the post that the whole point of this “work” is to check the impact of all our white stuff so it doesn’t infect our action, to give us a way to measure that. But I get that thinking about all that is still not ACTION itself. That’s why I’d like you to post this comment to my blog. Better yet: Howard wrote a guest essay for my blog about a year ago. Would you be willing to contribute this post – or some version of it – as a guest blog? It would be due to come out Dec.10. If you leave it as a reply on my blog now, I doubt that anyone is going to see it. It’s late. But all subscribers would see it next post. What do you think?
